com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveTreeWalkerIf

public interface XhiveTreeWalkerIf

You can use XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse libraries, documents, and subtrees of documents. The functions getRoot, nextNode, previousNode, and currentNode behave like the corresponding functions of w3c.org.dom.traversal.TreeWalker.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Summary
 Node currentNode()
          Returns the current node.
 Node firstNode()
          Returns the first node in document order, relative to the root node.
 Node getRoot()
          Returns the root, which is the starting point of traversal.
 Node lastNode()
          Returns the last node in document order, relative to the root node.
 Node nextNode()
          Get the next node in document order relative to the currentNode.
 Node previousNode()
          Get the previous visible node in document order relative to the current node.
 

Method Detail

getRoot

Node getRoot()
Returns the root, which is the starting point of traversal.

Returns:
The root.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

nextNode

Node nextNode()
Get the next node in document order relative to the currentNode. If a node is found, the current node is set to the found node.

Returns:
If found, the first visible next node, otherwise null.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

previousNode

Node previousNode()
Get the previous visible node in document order relative to the current node. If a node is found, the current node is set to the found node.

Returns:
If found, the first visible previous node, otherwise null.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

lastNode

Node lastNode()
Returns the last node in document order, relative to the root node. If a node is found, the current node is set to the found node.
You can use this function to start traversing backwards.

Returns:
The last node in document order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

firstNode

Node firstNode()
Returns the first node in document order, relative to the root node. If a node is found, the current node is set to the found node.

Returns:
The first node in document order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

currentNode

Node currentNode()
Returns the current node.

Returns:
The current node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
